intro: Diodia carnosa, commonly known as roughleaf bluestem, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features erect, branching stems that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its small, white to pale blue flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Diodia carnosa is often found in open, sunny habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils.
